com.amplifyframework.core

Class Amplify

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amplifyframework.core.Amplify
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnalyticsCategory, Auth

    public class Amplify
extends Object
    The Amplify System has the following responsibilities: 1) Add, Get and Remove categoryType plugins with the Amplify System 2) Configure and reset the Amplify System with the information from the amplifyconfiguration.json. Configure using amplifyconfiguration.json 
         
      Amplify.configure(getApplicationContext());

      • plugins

        private static ConcurrentHashMap<Category,ConcurrentHashMap<String,CategoryPlugin>> plugins
        Map of {Category, {pluginClass, pluginObject}}. { "AUTH" => { "keyForAuth" => "AmazonCognitoAuthPlugin@object" }, "STORAGE" => { "keyForStorage" => "AmazonS3StoragePlugin@object" }, "ANALYTICS" => { "keyForAmazonPinpoint" => "AmazonPinpointAnalyticsPlugin@object", "keyForAmazonKinesis" => "AmazonKinesisAnalyticsPlugin@object" }, "API" => { "keyForAWSAPIGatewayPlugin" => "AWSRESTAPIGatewayPlugin@object" } }

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public static void configure(Context context)
                      throws AmplifyAlreadyConfiguredException,
                             NoSuchPluginException
        Read the configuration from amplifyconfiguration.json file
        Parameters:
        context - Android context required to read the contents of file
        Throws:
        AmplifyAlreadyConfiguredException - thrown when already configured
        NoSuchPluginException - thrown when there is no plugin found for a configuration

      • configure

        public static void configure(Context context,
                             String environment)
                      throws AmplifyAlreadyConfiguredException,
                             NoSuchPluginException
        Read the configuration from amplifyconfiguration.json file
        Parameters:
        context - Android context required to read the contents of file
        environment - specifies the name of the environment being operated on. For example, "Default", "Custom", etc.
        Throws:
        AmplifyAlreadyConfiguredException - thrown when already configured
        NoSuchPluginException - thrown when there is no plugin found for a configuration

      • configure

        public static void configure(Context context,
                             AmplifyConfiguration amplifyConfiguration)
                      throws AmplifyAlreadyConfiguredException,
                             NoSuchPluginException
        Read the configuration from amplifyconfiguration.json file
        Parameters:
        context - Android context required to read the contents of file
        amplifyConfiguration - Pass the object via code that contains the configuration
        Throws:
        AmplifyAlreadyConfiguredException - thrown when already configured
        NoSuchPluginException - thrown when there is no plugin found for a configuration

      • configure

        public static void configure(Context context,
                             AmplifyConfiguration amplifyConfiguration,
                             String environment)
                      throws AmplifyAlreadyConfiguredException,
                             NoSuchPluginException
        Read the configuration from amplifyconfiguration.json file
        Parameters:
        context - Android context required to read the contents of file
        amplifyConfiguration - Pass the object via code that contains the configuration
        environment - specifies the name of the environment being operated on. For example, "Default", "Custom", etc.
        Throws:
        AmplifyAlreadyConfiguredException - thrown when already configured
        NoSuchPluginException - thrown when there is no plugin found for a configuration

      • addPlugin

        public static <P extends CategoryPlugin> void addPlugin(P plugin)
                                                 throws MismatchedPluginException
        Register a plugin with Amplify
        Type Parameters:
        P - any plugin that conforms to the CategoryPlugin interface
        Parameters:
        plugin - an implementation of a categoryType that conforms to the CategoryPlugin interface.
        Throws:
        MismatchedPluginException - when a plugin cannot be registered for this categoryType

      • removePlugin

        public static <P extends CategoryPlugin> void removePlugin(P plugin)
        Remove a registered plugin
        Type Parameters:
        P - any plugin that conforms to the CategoryPlugin interface
        Parameters:
        plugin - an implementation of a categoryType that conforms to the CategoryPlugin interface.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Reset Amplify to state where it is not configured. Remove all the plugins added. Remove the configuration stored.

      • getPlugin

        public static <P extends CategoryPlugin> CategoryPlugin getPlugin(String pluginKey)
        Retrieve a plugin of categoryType.
        Type Parameters:
        P - any plugin that conforms to the CategoryPlugin interface
        Parameters:
        pluginKey - the key that identifies the plugin implementation
        Returns:
        the plugin object

      • getPlugins

        public static ConcurrentHashMap<Category,ConcurrentHashMap<String,CategoryPlugin>> getPlugins()
        Retrieve the map of categoryType plugins. {Category => {PluginName => PluginObject}} A categoryType can have more than one plugins registered through the Amplify System. Each plugin is identified with a name.
        Returns:
        the map that represents the categoryType plugins.

      • getPluginForCategory

        public static CategoryPlugin getPluginForCategory(Category categoryType)
        Retrieve the plugin for a particular categoryType. Returns the plugin registered for a categoryType if one. the plugin returned by the selector if there are more than one plugin.
        Parameters:
        categoryType - Name of the categoryType
        Returns:
        the plugin registered and chosen for the catgeory passed in.
